name: Locanda dell'Amorosa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights, and it was absolutely fantastic experience. On many occasion, the "professional" photos on hotel's website are not true reflect of reality and often get disappointed but this hotel is different. The actual facility was even better, absolutely stunning setup. This hotel is great for both active sightseeing and just relax and enjoy the gorgeous yet peaceful Tuscan scenery. Their staff was very friendly, professional and really helpful for finding out whatever the request/things you are looking for. All the local restaurant recommended by them were really, really good. We really enjoyed the stay and can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to the Locanda and it has become even more beautiful since we were last there over 15 years ago. If you are looking for a unique setting, excellent service, divine cuisine and a sense of serenity, this is the place to be. It is expensive, and very elegant in a casual way. It is well-located for visits to Tuscan towns and wineries. We found the food at the restaurant to be wonderful, although the menu is somewhat limited for the unadventurous. Breakfast was terrific and there was a large variety of dishes, including freshly made scrambled eggs, delicious bacon and hams and lovely pastries with their own jams and honeys. Couldn't take advantage of the pool due to weather, but it looks lovely. The staff were wonderful and helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our all to brief visit.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bit out of the way but no problem to get to, a stay at Locanda dell'Amorosa feels like stepping back in time.
reviews.title: Everything you have pictured of Tuscany, at your doorstep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The layout of the charming buildings sees the rooms entered from within a large courtyard, around a bell tower, chapel and gardens. The pool sits high on a hill overlooking vineyards, situated perfectly to enjoy the sunsets. The room was lovely, high ceilings with massive old windows that opened to views of the surrounding hills. A foyer and separate walk-in cedar closet was especially charming, creating an atmosphere of a flat instead of a hotel room. The sagging bed and older bath show their age but didn't detract from the overall stay - keep in mind that this is not a modern, refurbished property. The restaurant was not our favourite meal, as it was more contemporary Italian than the traditional preparation which is what we were seeking. Service was good, and parking or congestion was not an issue as it is a large property set back from any roads with sprawling spaces surrounded by huge evergreens.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring Tuscany

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only issue we had was with a fashion photo shoot that was taking place while we were there. The cameras and crew dominated the hotel's spaces and were quite loud celebrating in the hallway at night. We mentioned it to the staff, feeling that they could have put us in another area of the hotel away from the production, and we were compensated fairly.
reviews.title: Very Romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Since I used the reviews on this site extensively before selecting a hotel in Tuscany- I began writing my own review in my head the moment I arrived! I stayed at the Locanda Dell Amorosa for 9 days (June 2007). I travelled with my mother for her 60th birthday. We flew into Rome and had arranged for a driver to take us to the hotel (another 2 hours). From the moment you arrive it seems almost too good to be true. It is 'perfectly rustic'...so perfect we joked it felt like a movie set for Tuscany! The hotel office staff spoke near perfect english and they directed us to our room (#43). It was lovely with a view of the front vineyard and cypress lined long long drive way. Here are the plus points: it is quiet and tranquil atmosphere, the furnishings are first rate, the hotel will arrange for anything you wish to do, the grounds are impeccable and great for walking, the service staff is top notch and also speak english. The included breakfast is great (eggs, meats, breads, scones, fruits, cerals). The reasturant is wonderful food.
reviews.title: Beyond Beautiful- but remote...

likes.liked: — The beauty everywhere you looked and the english speaking staff
likes.disliked: — Difficult internet access, horrible TV, too few DVD, no library, pool not heated, no gym

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have 4 bikes you can borrow to ride the area. You are minutes from Sinalunga which is an un-inspired little town. But does have an ATM and necessities if needed. You are 15 minutes away from Luciango, 20 from Castlemunzio, and 40 from Pienza, and 50 from Cortona, and 30 from Siena....so you can see plenty using this as a base location. There are fields of sunflowers on the property as well as vineyards.
reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and stay here

likes.liked: — absolutely everything - well-appointed rooms, big and comfortable bed, outstanding service, great location to base stay in Tuscany
likes.disliked: — nothing - can honestly say hotel is without fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The negatives: the pool is not heated although unearthly beautiful with its infinity edge falling into a tuscan landscape. The food in the wine bar (only place to get ANYthing to eat during the day) is very expensive and odd (no sandwich of anykind). The cleaning staff are a bit too diligent-practically re-packing you everyday! You are really remote. There is no place to walk to get a bit of lunch if you wanted....The resturant is very very expensive ($100 Euro with no wine or dessert for two). While they offer DVD in the lobby to borrow they only have about 30 to choose from! The 'satelite' TV means you get only 2 english channels and those are both based in England and offer no american news. No american paper either (note nearly 90% of their guests are American) They have a computer in the lobby with internet access- but you have to wait and wait to use. That was silly. No other resort of its price would have such few options to get American news. There is no gym (although they certainly have room to add one.) You need either a car (which we had for one day, delivered to the hotel too) or a driver (we used Roberto Becchi of PBS fame and worth every penny by far). Feel free to contact me for any questions about what I may have forgottent to mention......would I stay there again? YES. But I would bring DVDs, and a cell phone to call home or get e-mail that way...
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Locanda for 4 nights and we wish we would have been able to extend our stay, as this is one of the finest properties we have ever stayed in - anywhere. Once we found the property, which wasn't the easiest to find, the entire experience was absolutely incredible. We were upgraded to a fantastic room (56) with a view of the gorgeous courtyard. The property itself is stunning - photos do not do the property justice. You have to visit the Locanda to truly experience its magic. This 13th century property is in pristine condition and offers immaculate and lush grounds, an incredible infinity pool (the ice tea at the pool was delicious) with a spectacular view of Sinalunga, walking trails, and an on-site vineyard.
reviews.title: A Nice Experience

likes.disliked: — It's location has its positive and negative points depending on what your goals are

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff could not have been more helpful in assisting us with all of our excursions. They helped us maximize our brief stay in Tuscany by providing a recommended itinerary of wineries and other sights, driving directions, restaurant recommendations and reservations, as well as helping us change the drop off location for our rental car.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Amorosa for the Tuscany leg of our trip to Italy for our 10th wedding anniversary. Our stay at the Amorosa was the highlight of the trip. The property was beautiful and the staff was very helpful. We took trips to Chianti for wine tasting and Siena and Pienza for sight-seeing. The short trip to Pienza, which was recommended by a young man at the front desk, was probably the highlight of our entire trip.
reviews.title: Simply Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have absolutely nothing negative to say about the Amorosa and would love to return. We've travelled quite a bit and stayed in some pretty nice places but this is one place we'll remember forever.
reviews.title: Paradise in the heart of Tuscany

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stunningly beautiful and peaceful. Ideal location for exploring the hill towns and Siena. My only problem with this resort is that it is so perfect that it is a struggle to leave each day to go exploring.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel. Just beautiful.
reviews.title: Simply Amazing- would definitely go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great restaurant as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel... loved our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To call this place a hotel would be an injustice. This place is a palace where they have a room for you to stay. The premises are unreal!!! A beautiful garden with a great view. An infinity pool that looks out onto the rolling hills of Tuscany. A great romantic restaurant.
reviews.title: One of the Best Places I have ever stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was way too big for me and my wife and absolutely gorgeous. We had two stories with two bedrooms. The staff will pretty much
reviews.title: Perfect relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this place for only two nights which was unfortunate. During the day, we were going to explore some of the neighboring town but instead stayed in the hotel pool all day.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and location

likes.liked: — The location, the comfort of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: The only problem is you will have to rent a car to get to this place. But then, it gives you the opportunity to see some of the neighboring towns.
reviews.title: A lovely respite
Beautiful
reviews.text: I must admit, I'm trying to find something that can be improved with this hotel but it really was superb.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We truly appreciate exclusive hotels and agree that in most cases "you get what you pay for". Locanda dell' Amorsa is a complete disappointment, The website is great. Tuscany is great. Siena is great. Locanda dell'Amorosa is average at best. The room at Locanada is by far one of the most disappointing things I have ever experienced on any vacation in my life. When I respectfully expressed my dissatisfaction with my room I was met with complete indifference. Finally, a staff member stated he agreed our room was really not that nice but there was nothing he could do about it. While the validation of our opinion was consoling we were left with a below standard room with an inflated price. It makes me sad thinking about it. A visit to Tuscany deserves better.
reviews.title: Over promised and under delivered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: The Locand Dell'Amorosa is in a beautiful setting. The hotels grounds are very nice. We had a room that was large with a nice sitting area. The bathroom was large and well appointed. The restaurant was very nice with a lot if atmosphere in a beautiful room. The restaurant staff was terrific. The food was very good but the menu was fairly limited.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in a beautiful setting with a great staff that makes you feel at home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downside to the hotel was that taking day trips to San Gimignano or Sienna meant time on the autostrada. Additionally, unless you are willing to drve distances on the autostrada for dinner you will likely eat all your dinners at the hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful country hotel set within acres of vineyards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is without a doubt a beautiful hotel with very beautiful views at all angles. Italy is an expensive country however I did feel that this hotel took every opportunity to ensure they took every last penny and I think because of this found it a little disheartening. The staff are lovely and provide an exceptional service at all times. The food in the restaurant is a little pretentious, served in very small portions which I would describe as far from what Italian hospitality is. My time in Tuscany was made very special by a local taxi driver called Fabio Sacperrotta whom by the end of my time in Italy became a very dear friend. Fabio is not only a taxi driver, Fabio is an expert in wine (by expert I mean 'Expert'), he is a historian and ambassador for Tuscany and fluent in English. Fabio drove us all over Tuscany, taking us to food festivals, wine tasting, historical trips, open aired theatre at the top of Montepulcianno, recommended superb rustic restaurants and local foods. This may seem like an advert for Mr Scaperrotta however if you are staying at this hotel or anywhere in Tuscany he will ensure you leave Italy happy and fulfilled. Thank you Fabio. Contact Fabio: Web. www.tuscanycountrytravel.it, Email. fabio@tuscanycountrytravel.it, Tel. 338 5011824
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had read many good write-ups but we were very disappointed.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the Amorosa on Tripadvisor, and couldn't believe the reviews or photos I saw. But, we stayed there for a week this summer, and I have to say...it lives up to the hype. Fantastic location for seeing almost all of Tuscany, and the hotel itself is stunning. Our room - the Tower Suite - was the perfect combination of unique and comfortable and luxurious. The grounds are beautiful (you're essentially hanging out in a medieval farming village), the restaurant is delicious, and the staff was amazing...they helped us plan out every day of our trip, and had some fantastic recommendations for food and sights. All in all, it's expensive as all hell (especially with the exchange rate these days) but well worth it if you're looking for the perfect Tuscan getaway. We'll definitely be back.
reviews.title: This place is ridiculous.
Felt like I was in a movie!
reviews.text: Was there with my husband and two children to celebrate my 50th! We loved the property - it is incredibly pictureque. Every room has a magnificent view. The service and staff are wonderful - all hugs and kisses when we left - they were like family. The facility is beautiful and well maintained. The restaurant is pricey but very good. They also directed us to a restaurant in Sinalunga that was wonderful. Great location to do numerous day trips throughout Tuscany!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Locanda Dell Amorosa was everything we hoped it would be. It was beautiful, quiet, peaceful and restful. The staff there are superb - well informed about the area, extremely helpful and very nice. Amorosa has an amazing continental breakfast that comes with the price of the room and the restaurant on site is excellent. While the rooms are not lush and extravagant, they are well appointed and have all the amenities one might need. The cleaning staff keeps the hotel perfectly spotless - I have never seen a staff clean so thoroughly! And the setting, well...it couldn't be more romantic or special. We cannot wait to return to Amorosa. And next time, we'll skip the stop in Rome and Venice and spend all our time in this lovely locanda.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Tuscan Respite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Amorosa in October of 2007. I had found it just by searching on the web and had super high expectations based on the website photos and the reviews posted on tripadvisor. We started our trip in Italy at a Relais and Chateaux hotel, Il Pelicano, in Porto Ercole which was truly 5 star (too expensive but still i would highly recommend!). I had similar expectations for Amorosa. We drove through the absolutely beautiful Tuscan countryside, through towns like Montelcino, and expected the hotel to be in a similar setting. I was so disappointed when we arrived as the hotel is in the area of Sinalunga that is much more industrial feeling and there are busy, loud roads right next to the hotel. I expected to walk the serene, quiet country roads through beautiful vineyards... The vineyards around the hotel were completely dying out and not maintained at all. So i was sad and immediately tried to think about how we could move to another hotel near the picturesque wine towns without losing our money! However, the Amorosa started to grow on me. The rooms were very nice (not 5 star, but very nice), the grounds were kept very nice and clean, the cleaning staff was great, and the front desk people were super helpful recommending wonderful wineries for tours (go to Poggio Antico and Poliziano) and truly great restaurants in the area. The restaurant at the hotel was very good too. The breakfast spread was just okay and the wine bar wasn't exactly as i was expecting. Also when we arrived there were a couple sets of really loud, obnoxious Americans in the courtyard and I feared that was all that was staying there. Happily, we found many Italians and international guests also. Overall, after the initial letdown, we had a nice 5 days there and we will remember our stay fondly.
reviews.title: Great staff but not as nice as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited Amorosa in October, and was pleased that the hotel was even more lovely than the photos on their website. The hotel was fully booked, but did not seem crowded. Based on earlier reviews, we did not visit the hotel's restaurant, but instead tried several fabulous places nearby.
reviews.title: Beautiful Out-of-the-way Hotel

likes.disliked: — A little too far from usual day-trip places

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: We just got back from a two week trip through Italy. Locanda Amorosa was certainly one of the high points! Beautiful property - well preserved, old farm but wonderfully modernized rooms. We stayed in Room 54, the special suite, and it was special. Two floors, a balcony, a loggia to lay out on or eat on, walk in closet, super large bathroom, large livingroom. I could have moved in! The staff at the front desk are friendly, knowledgable, helpful. Housekeeping services are great, the pool is beautiful (though not heated), the included breakfast was appropriate and it even has a wine bar. The only down side is the restaurant in sight -- we went one night and unfortunately the service was uneven, the food only average and it was expensive for what it was. The best experience is to eat in town, 5 minutes away at Focillo, a local trattoria. Great food, great fun, great prices. Other than that we recommend this property wholeheartedly!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Tuscan Experience!

likes.liked: — Property is Beautiful! Room was Wonderful!

reviews.title: Charming and well located
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in a Junior Suite with our small children (hopefully not the ones referred to in the previous review!) On first impressions I thought I was a bit disappointed with the hotel but it really grew on me (and we had just come from somewhere that had been styled very differently). We have never had any maids clean the room as well as the ladies here did - it was such a treat. The pool area was nice apart from the standard loud Americans (sorry to say it chaps but why do alot of you speak at a level so we all have to listen to your tales!). I agree with the earlier review that the food was pretty awful though and if you dont get to order lunch before about 2.30 pm you are going to go hungry!! On the postivie side, the hotel had losts of charm, history, the staff were very helpful and I would definitely recommend it. Yes, it is expensive but so is all of Italy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip: Montepulciano is a lovely drive from the hotel. Siena was nice enough but we were a bit disappointed with it in the end, but the scenary around there is spectacular.
reviews.title: Beautiful place, wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: On our recent trip to Tuscany, Italy we stayed at the Locanda dell' Amorosa in Sinalunga. It is an outstanding place with all the comforts you can imagine. The staff is wonderful and attentive. The maid service comes around before the evening hours and asks if you need fresh linens. They also folded, and hung up some of my husbands shirts.......they are very professional. The restaurant is top notch and has a lot of ambiance. While we were there, it was crowded every evening with people staying at the hotel and other couples out for the night. They have a complementary buffet breakfast that is delicious and an evening wine bar where you can taste some of their wines. We didn't get a chance to swim in their pool as it was a little chilly and we didn't have time, but it was in a very nice location on the grounds and had an awesome view of the surrounding countryside. Athough our room as one of the less expensive rooms that they offer, it was still a four star experience... Nice views, clean, comfortable and spacious. It is a fabulous place to stay for a wonderful vacation in beautiful Tuscany. We will definitely go back again.
reviews.title: Nice Facilities But Not Worth The Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for the four night minimum which they required when we booked the room. We had a deluxe suite (Room 50) which was very disappointing in that it was immediately above the reception area and our view was of the parking lot and town beyond.
reviews.title: Already scheming how I can return...

likes.disliked: — Lack of good restaurants in the immediate vicinity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I’ve read countless reviews raving about this place but resisted booking there ourselves because we like the feel and central location of Pienza as the place to stay in Tuscany. Personal friends had stayed recently and raved about it to the point that we felt we really should give it a try. Glad we did. It’s all they say. I probably took more pictures of the grounds of the hotel (it’s actually a tiny hamlet like place of several buildings including its own church) than any other place on this trip. There are flowers spilling everywhere.
reviews.title: Finally we get to stay at this lovely estate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is rustic charm personified without being overly cutesy. There is a separate enotecha where you can pop in for a bit of wine beautifully served in lovely crystal and where breakfast is served in the mornings. There is a nice restaurant with an outdoor terrace and a lovely sitting room with internet station. Our room which was of the “standard” variety was spacious and comfortably kitted out as our English friends say, but it was less special or luxurious than the totality of the place. I now see what others have been raving about.
reviews.title: Perfect Place After Busy Rome Adventure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: We spent two nights here after five in Rome. It was fantastically quiet and quaint. We ate at the restaurant both nights and enjoyed. Originally we were going to rent a car and then decided against it as we had a lot of winery visits scheduled and wanted to imbibe. So we took the advice posted here on Sept.1 recommending Fabio at Tuscany County Travel. He and his sister took us to our appointments and then showed us their corner of Tuscany. He even arranged a truffle hunt for us!
reviews.title: Beauty in a rustic setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was clean and quiet. Yes the room was a bit spendy but we thought it was well worth it. NO there are no irons or ironing boards. We have stayed at 4 and 5 star hotels all over Europe and this is normal.
reviews.title: Bueautiful Property but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only gripe is that coffee service is slow at breakfast.
reviews.title: Quiet perfection in Tuscan countryside

description: The location exudes an atmosphere of true serenity and sweetness and anyone exposed to it will be awestruck. Each room has its own character and design. Rustic furniture of peasant origins is mixed with antique furniture, prints and paintings. Some, that open directly to the outdoors give the sense of having a place of one’s own; others have a relaxing view of the typical Sienese countryside; yet others look out onto the complex’s quadrangle and face the lodgings the peasants at one time inhabited.
